guntur_audit.source_file: Guntur District  PGRS review meeting notes 07.11.2025 (1).md

lapse_categories.category: GRA did not speak to citizen directly
examples: Officer closed grievance without calling citizen to verify resolution
GRA marked case resolved without speaking to applicant
No telephonic verification done before closure

lapse_categories.category: Not visited site / No field verification
lapse_categories.telugu: సైట్ సందర్శన లేదు / క్షేత్ర పరిశీలన చేయలేదు
examples: Survey department officer marked resolved without site visit
Revenue officer closed case without field inspection
No physical verification of work completion

lapse_categories.category: Wrong / Blank / Not related to grievance closure comments
lapse_categories.telugu: GRA స్వయంగా WRONG/BLANK /NOT RELATED TO GRIEVANCE/IN FUTURE TENSE/ ENDORSEMENT ఇచ్చారు
examples: Endorsement comment not related to actual grievance
Blank endorsement uploaded
Future tense used ('will be done') instead of completion status

lapse_categories.category: GRA did not speak properly / scolded / used abusive language
examples: Officer used rude language with citizen
GRA scolded applicant instead of helping
Abusive behavior reported during interaction

lapse_categories.category: Wrong department assignment / Not under jurisdiction
lapse_categories.telugu: GRA అర్జి తన పరిధిలోనిది/డిపార్ట్మెంట్కు సంబంధించినది కాదని మూసివేసారు
examples: Case wrongly marked as 'not under our department'
Jurisdiction issue - passed to wrong department
Officer refused claiming not their responsibility

lapse_categories.category: Improper enquiry photo / enquiry report / redressal flag uploaded
lapse_categories.telugu: GRA స్వయంగా Improper Enquiry photo/Enquiry Report/Redressal Flag అప్లోడ్ చేశారు
examples: Uploaded incorrect or irrelevant photos as evidence
Enquiry report incomplete or not matching grievance
Redressal flag marked wrong

lapse_categories.category: GRA did not provide endorsement personally
examples: Junior officer provided endorsement instead of GRA
Endorsement delegated to lower official
No personal endorsement from responsible officer

lapse_categories.category: GRA did not spend time explaining issue to applicant
lapse_categories.telugu: GRA స్వయంగా అర్జిదారునికి సమస్యను వివరించకవాటనకి సమయం కేటాయించలేదు
examples: Officer did not explain resolution process to citizen
No time spent clarifying issues with applicant
Rushed through case without proper explanation

lapse_categories.category: GRA closed by forwarding to lower-level official instead of resolving
lapse_categories.telugu: GRA స్వయంగా పరిష్కరించకుండా బకందాయ అధికారికి పంపించి అర్జిని మూసివేసారు
examples: Tahsildar forwarded case to VRO and closed it
Senior officer delegated to junior without resolution
Case forwarded downward without solving

lapse_categories.category: GRA intentionally avoided work / refused service
lapse_categories.telugu: GRA ఉద్దేశపూర్వకంగా పని చేయకుండా ఆపటం/సైట్లో/ స్టాఫ్ పని చేయడం లేదు/మళ్ళీ రండి అని చెప్పి పని ఆపేస్తారు
examples: Officer said 'come again later' repeatedly
Work intentionally stopped by saying officer not available
Site work not happening - asked to return multiple times
Officer threatened citizen if complaint not withdrawn
GRA pleaded to close case without proper resolution
Citizen persuaded to accept incomplete work

lapse_categories.category: GRA did not work and involved political persons
lapse_categories.telugu: GRA పని చేయకుండా పొలిటికల్ వ్యక్తుల వలన ఇంట్లో చేసి ఇరందపడుతారు
examples: Political interference caused work stoppage
Officer involved political persons causing trouble
Political pressure led to improper handling

lapse_categories.category: GRA took bribe / asked for bribe / stopped work for not paying
lapse_categories.telugu: GRA లంచం తీసుకున్నారు/లంచం అడగారు/లంచం కు సంపని చేయకుండా ఆపేరు
examples: Bribe demanded to complete work
Work stopped because bribe not paid
Officer took money for service delivery

other_audits.name: Improper Redressal Lapses Definitions
findings: Behavioral lapses: 5 categories (abusive language, threats, bribery, political interference, intentional avoidance)
Procedural lapses: 7 categories (not speaking to citizen, no endorsement, no explanation, wrong endorsement, improper evidence, forwarding to lower official, wrong jurisdiction)

behavioral_lapses: GRA did not speak properly / scolded / used abusive language
GRA threatened / pleaded / persuaded the applicant
GRA took a bribe / asked for a bribe / stopped work for not paying a bribe
GRA did not work and involved political persons, causing trouble
GRA intentionally avoided doing the work by saying 'officer is not available / site work is not happening / come again later'
procedural_lapses: GRA did not speak directly with the citizen
GRA did not provide the endorsement personally
GRA did not spend time explaining the issue to the applicant personally
GRA gave a WRONG / BLANK / NOT RELATED TO GRIEVANCE / FUTURE TENSE endorsement
GRA uploaded an improper enquiry photo / enquiry report / redressal flag
GRA closed the grievance by forwarding it to a lower-level official instead of resolving it personally
GRA closed the grievance stating that it does not fall under his/her jurisdiction/department

other_audits.name: Constituency Pre-Audit
findings: Improper redressal rates vary from 5.31% to 85.60% across districts
Common pattern: 'GRA did not speak to citizen' is top lapse in all districts

edge_cases.example: YSR Kadapa Proddatur constituency - 58.56% improper redressal
edge_cases.pattern: Consistent high improper rates across multiple months
Higher than state average behavioral issues
GRA not speaking to citizen is universal issue

other_audits.name: Ananthapur District Department Audit
findings: Revenue (CCLA) has highest audit pendency: 2077 cases (51.25%)
Severe manpower shortage: 8 members appointed but only 2 available in Revenue
District has highest memo pendency statewide: 871 memos pending
systemic_issues: Lack of departmental review meetings (only Police conducted)
High memo pendency not being addressed
Low citizen satisfaction across major departments
Pre-audit improper rate: 50.60%, Post-audit reopen rate: 52.3%

edge_cases.description: Only 2 out of 8 appointed Revenue audit staff available

edge_cases.pattern: Quality issues in core service departments

other_audits.name: West Godavari Top 10 Officers Pre-Audit Poor Performance
findings: Recurring officer-level lapses despite continuous oversight
Joint Director of Fisheries: 76.67% improper redressal
WhatsApp alerts, voice recordings, and review meetings not resulting in improvement

top_poor_performers.pattern: Consistently high improper rates across months

common_lapses: GRA did not speak to citizen
GRA did not speak to citizen

systemic_failures: HOD not conducting regular review meetings
HOD lacks awareness of GRA performance status
No corrective or disciplinary actions initiated
Ineffective coordination with District Collector's office
No departmental audit officers monitoring PGRS activities
recommendations: Individual performance counseling for repeat offenders
Timely GRA response within 48 hours to pre-audit observations
Departmental review notes submitted before Monday meetings
Refresher workshops on communication and documentation
Model redressal templates to be circulated
Link pre-audit findings to annual performance appraisals

edge_cases.description: Officers with 3+ consecutive months of high improper rates
examples: Joint Director Fisheries
District Fisheries Officer
Tahsildar Poduru

edge_cases.description: HOD unaware of departmental GRA performance metrics
Weekly review meetings not utilized effectively by HODs
CM personally monitoring due to recurring lapses

key_insights: GRA not speaking to citizen is the #1 lapse category across ALL districts (42.19% in Guntur)
Behavioral lapses are lower (4.68%) but more severe than procedural lapses (19.42%)
APCRDA has highest improper rate in Guntur (50.51%), followed by Medical Education (23.91%)
Manpower shortage is systemic issue - Ananthapur has only 2/8 audit staff available
Memo pendency crisis - 871 memos pending in Ananthapur alone
Citizen dissatisfaction correlates with Revenue & Survey departments (77%+ dissatisfaction)
Officer-level repeat offenders exist despite continuous monitoring (e.g., Fisheries officers 70%+ improper)
HOD accountability gap - departments lack internal review mechanisms
Pre-audit mechanism working but corrective actions not being taken
CM-level escalation indicates severity of recurring issues

parsing_issues: Guntur file too large (51116 tokens) - parsed via grep and strategic section reading
Telugu text in lapse categories - preserved for bilingual training
Complex table structures - extracted via pattern matching
ambiguous_data: Some percentages don't sum to exactly 100% due to rounding - acceptable variance < 1%
Officer names sometimes have mobile numbers, sometimes don't - extracted as-is
Department naming inconsistencies (e.g., 'Revenue (CCLA)' vs 'Revenue CCLA') - standardized
